GameObjects

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameObjects.GameObjects
      • GameObjects.Player

  • public class Player
extends GameObjects
    This class is the one which is going to be used as the player in the game.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    FarisAlasmary
    See Also:
    Player

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(int x,
      int y,
      double angle,
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage characterImage)
        Constructs the player object.
        Parameters:
        x - is the x-coordinate of the player
        y - is the y-coordinate of the player
        angle - is the rotation angle
        characterImage - is the image that represent the player object on the panel
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if there is no characterImage

      • Player

        public Player(java.awt.image.BufferedImage characterImage)
        Constructs the player object. This constructor is the most common in use.
        Parameters:
        characterImage - is the image that represent the player object on the panel
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if there is no characterImage

      • Player

        public Player(java.awt.image.BufferedImage characterImage,
      Position position)
        Constructs the player object.
        Parameters:
        characterImage - is the image that represent the player object on the panel
        position - is the position of the player on the panel
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if there is no characterImage OR position

      • Player

        public Player(GameObjects other)
        The copy constructor.
        Parameters:
        other - is the image that represent the player object on the panel
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if there is no GameObjects object
        See Also:
        GameObjects

    • Method Detail

      • getBounds

        public java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
        The getter of the player's boundaries. It will be used to detect the collision
        Overrides:
        getBounds in class GameObjects
        Returns:
        It returns the bounded rectangle

      • Fire

        public void Fire()
        This method is to fire bullets from the player. It will be invoked automatically inside the MouseHandler if the player clicked the mouse left-button.
        See Also:
        MouseHandler

      • getBullets

        public java.util.LinkedList<Bullet> getBullets()
        The getter of the player's bullets.
        Returns:
        It returns a reference to a linked list of type "Bullet" which will be used as player's bullets.

      • setBullets

        public void setBullets(java.util.LinkedList<Bullet> bullets)
        The setter of the player's bullets.
        Parameters:
        bullets - is a reference to a linked list of type "Bullet" that is going to be used as player's bullets.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if there is no GameObjects object
